subject.name: Engineering Mathematics-II
subject.description: Explores complex analysis, differential equations, sequences and series, Laplace transforms, and Fourier series with engineering applications. Focuses on mathematical modeling, computation, and analysis techniques essential for problem-solving in science and engineering.
objectives: To introduce the concept of complex functions and analytic properties
To apply contour integration and residue theorem for evaluating integrals
To solve linear differential equations using analytical and transform methods
To study convergence of sequences and series using standard tests
To understand and apply Laplace and Fourier transforms to engineering problems

units.title: Complex Analysis - I
topics: Functions of a complex variable, limit, continuity, and differentiability
Analytic function and Cauchy-Riemann equations (Cartesian and polar form)
Harmonic function and harmonic conjugate

units.title: Complex Analysis - II
topics: Line and contour integrals
Cauchy’s theorem and Cauchy’s integral formula (without proof)
Taylor and Laurent series expansions
Zeros of analytic functions, isolated singularities, and residues
Cauchy’s residue theorem (without proof) and its applications

units.title: Ordinary Differential Equations
topics: Linear differential equations of nth order with constant coefficients
Homogeneous and non-homogeneous equations
Differential equations with variable coefficients
Cauchy-Euler equations
Method of variation of parameters

units.title: Sequence and Series
topics: Introduction to sequence and series
Nature and convergence of series
Tests of convergence: Comparison, D’Alembert’s ratio, Cauchy’s root, Raabe’s, Logarithmic, and Cauchy’s condensation test

units.title: Laplace Transform
topics: Definition, existence theorem, and properties of Laplace transform
Laplace transform of periodic functions
Inverse Laplace transform and convolution theorem
Applications to solve ordinary differential equations

units.title: Fourier Series
topics: Fourier series for general periodic functions
Fourier series for odd and even functions
Half-range sine and cosine series
Parseval’s theorem and its applications
